net.xeoh.plugins.informationbroker.util

Class InformationBrokerUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.jcores.jre.utils.VanillaUtil<T>
      • net.xeoh.plugins.base.util.VanillaPluginUtil<InformationBroker>
        • net.xeoh.plugins.informationbroker.util.InformationBrokerUtil
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Plugin, InformationBroker

    public class InformationBrokerUtil
extends VanillaPluginUtil<InformationBroker>
implements InformationBroker
    Helper functions for the InformationBroker interface. The util uses the embedded interface to provide more convenience features.
    Author:
    Ralf Biedert
    See Also:
    InformationBroker

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public <T> T get(java.lang.Class<? extends InformationItem<T>> id,
        T... dflt)
        Returns the value for the given id or dflt if neither the key nor the default was present. For example, to retrieve the current user name and to get "unknown" if none was present, you could write:

        get(UserName.class, "unknown");

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the return value.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID to request.
        dflt - The default value to return if no item was found.
        Returns:
        Returns the requested item, a default if the item was not present or null in case neither was found.

      • subscribeAll

        public void subscribeAll(InformationListener<java.lang.Void> listener,
                java.lang.Class<?>... all)
        Subscribes to a number of items. The listener is called only when all items are available or when all were available and a single item changed. For example, to subscribe to two items you could write:

        subscribeAll(listener, ItemA.class, ItemB.class);

        Use get() from inside the listener to obtain the specific items.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener called when all prerequisites are met. Note that the listener will be called without any object (i.e., item is null). You must use the broker's get() function.
        all - All IDs we should subscribe to.

      • publish

        public <T> void publish(java.lang.Class<? extends InformationItem<T>> channel,
               T item,
               PublishOption... options)
        Description copied from interface: InformationBroker
        Publishes a new information item. The item will be made available to all listeners subscribed to the item, or requesting it later. For example, to publish the current user name you could write:

        publish(UserName.class, "John Doe");

        Specified by:
        publish in interface InformationBroker
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the item to wait for.
        Parameters:
        channel - The channel for which the new object should be published.
        item - The items to publish.
        options - A number of options the publish() method understands.

      • subscribe

        public <T> void subscribe(java.lang.Class<? extends InformationItem<T>> channel,
                 InformationListener<T> listener,
                 SubscribeOption... options)
        Description copied from interface: InformationBroker
        Subscribes to a given information item. The listener will be called as soon as the item changes. It will also be called when the item has already been set before. For example, to subscribe to the latest location of a device (provided as a String) you could write:

        plugin.subscribe(UserName.class, new InformationListener<String>() {
            public void update(String item) {
                 ...
            }
        });

        Also see the InformationBrokerUtil, it contains many useful convenience functions.
        Specified by:
        subscribe in interface InformationBroker
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the item to wait for.
        Parameters:
        channel - The item / ID / channel to subscribe to
        listener - The lister will be called whenever the value of the ID changes; and it will be called right away if the information item has already been set before.
        options - A number of options the subscribe() method understands.

      • unsubscribe

        public void unsubscribe(InformationListener<?> listener)
        Description copied from interface: InformationBroker
        Unsubscribes the given information listener. It will not be called anymore afterwards.
        Specified by:
        unsubscribe in interface InformationBroker
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to unsubscribe.
